macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: S&P 500 Closes Flat as Markets Digest Gains
items.summary: The S&P 500 dropped 9.95 points (0.14%) to finish at 6,940 on Friday, with the index trading in a narrow range between 6,890 and 6,985 throughout the week. The market showed choppy trading with no clear directional momentum.

items.title: December CPI Meets Expectations at 2.7% Annualized Rate
items.summary: Monthly inflation data released Tuesday showed overall inflation up 0.3% and core inflation up 0.2% in December, with the annualized inflation rate at 2.7%, matching analyst forecasts. Core inflation came in lower than the expected 0.3% increase.

items.title: Small Caps Lead Market Rotation; Tech Momentum Cools
items.summary: The Russell 2000 gained 2% for the week while the Nasdaq lagged, signaling a rotation from technology into cyclical sectors including industrials, materials, energy, and defense. Small-cap leadership reflects risk-on sentiment.

items.title: Semiconductor Stocks Drive Tech Gains; Broadcom and Micron Rally
items.summary: Broadcom rose 2.5% and Micron Technology surged 7.8% on Friday, with semiconductor companies providing support to broader market moves despite overall tech sector momentum cooling.

items.title: Mixed Bank Earnings: PNC Beats, Regions Financial Misses
items.summary: Regional bank earnings showed divergent results with Pittsburgh-based PNC jumping 3.8% after beating fourth-quarter targets, while Regions Financial fell 2.6% following disappointing earnings.

items.title: Treasury Yields Rise; 10-Year Reaches 4.23%
items.summary: The 10-year Treasury yield climbed to 4.23% from 4.17%, while the 2-year yield rose to 3.60% from 3.57%, reflecting shifting expectations for Federal Reserve policy.

items.title: Gold Prices Decline but Remain Up 5% for January
items.summary: Gold prices fell 0.6% during the week but maintain a 5% gain for the month, reflecting ongoing volatility amid economic and geopolitical uncertainty.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: U.S. Bitcoin Strategic Reserve Faces Legal Hurdles
items.summary: White House Crypto Director Patrick Witt highlighted legal complexities as a major barrier to establishing a U.S. Bitcoin Strategic Reserve, with the DOJ and OLC addressing cross-agency coordination issues.

items.title: Ancient Bitcoin Whale Sells 500 BTC After 12 Years
items.summary: A whale that accumulated 5,000 BTC in 2013 sold 500 BTC worth $47.77 million on January 18, marking the latest in 2,500 BTC transferred to exchanges for $260 million profit; 2,500 BTC remain held.

items.title: Ethereum Slips Amid Wall Street Rally but ETH/BTC Signals Upside
items.summary: Ethereum decoupled from the rallying Russell 2000 while its ETH/BTC ratio trended higher, indicating early capital rotation into altcoins with cautious optimism.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: NVIDIA Releases Alpamayo Platform for Mercedes-Benz Level 4 Autonomous Driving
items.summary: NVIDIA launched Alpamayo, powering Mercedes-Benz's upcoming CLA vehicle with Level 4 autonomous capabilities. Additionally, Nemotron Speech ASR processes speech 10x faster and is integrated into Bosch in-car systems.

items.title: NVIDIA Unveils Vera Rubin Superchip at CES 2026 with 50 Petaflops Inference
items.summary: At CES 2026, NVIDIA introduced the Vera Rubin superchip, delivering 5x faster inference performance than previous generations. Lenovo announced Qira, a personal AI super-agent across devices, and Boston Dynamics declared Atlas humanoid robot production-ready.

items.title: OpenAI to Test Ads in ChatGPT for U.S. Free and Go Tier Users
items.summary: OpenAI begins testing ads at the bottom of ChatGPT answers for logged-in U.S. adults on free and Go tiers, without influencing responses or selling user data. CEO Sam Altman emphasized it supports accessibility amid 800 million weekly users.

items.title: Falcon-H1R 7B Model Matches Performance of 7x Larger Systems on Math Benchmarks
items.summary: The compact Falcon-H1R model with 7 billion parameters scores 88.1% on advanced math benchmarks, enabling applications in robotics, autonomous vehicles, and edge devices.

items.title: Microsoft Launches Agentic Features in Dynamics 365 for Retail AI Shopping Assistants
items.summary: Microsoft previews agentic features in Dynamics 365 starting February 2026, enabling retailers to build autonomous customer experiences amid 70% consumer acceptance of AI shopping assistants.

items.title: McKinsey Scales to 20,000 AI Agents and Tests Candidates on AI Collaboration
items.summary: McKinsey increased AI agents from 3,000 to 20,000 in 18 months and now evaluates job candidates on AI collaboration skills. Exabeam launched AI Agent Security to monitor tools for threats.

items.title: Apple to Use Google's AI to Power Siri as Alphabet Hits $4 Trillion Valuation
items.summary: Alphabet joined the $4 trillion valuation club due to AI leadership, while Apple will integrate Google's AI into Siri. PepsiCo uses AI for physics-accurate warehouse simulations.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: China's Tech Surge in Rockets, Robotics, and Flying Cars Fuels Stock Rally
items.summary: Chinese tech shares have rallied sharply in early 2026, with an onshore tech gauge up 13% and Hong Kong-listed firms up 6%, driven by advances in commercial rockets, robotics, and flying cars despite economic fragility. Upcoming listings include Xpeng’s flying-car unit and rocket maker LandSpace.

items.title: Google Seeks Court Delay on Sharing Data with Rivals Amid Monopoly Ruling Appeal
items.summary: Google has requested a judge to postpone sharing data with competitors like OpenAI while appealing a ruling that found it holds an illegal monopoly in online search. The company argues it risks losing trade secrets and emphasizes user choice and rapid innovation.
